# Discussion 14 Section - 8.8 Exerecise 26 (pg 496)

**In Exercises 25 â€“ 30, use the Taylor series given in Key Idea 8.8.1 to create the Taylor series of the given functions.**

26. $f(x) = e^{-x}$

From 8.8.1 the Taylor series approximation of $e^x$ is

$$
e^x = \sum_{n=0}^{\infty} \frac{x^n}{n!} = 1 + x + \frac{x^2}{2!} + \frac{x^3}{3!} + ...
$$

$$
e^{-x} = \sum_{n=0}^{\infty} \frac{-1^n}{n!}x^n = 1 - x + \frac{x^2}{2!} - \frac{x^3}{3!} + ...
$$
```{r}
library(tidyverse)
curve(expr = exp(1)^-x, -2,2, col='red')
taylor <- function(x) {1-x + (x^2)/factorial(2)- (x^3)/factorial(3) + (x^4)/factorial(4) - (x^5)/factorial(5)}
curve(taylor, -2,2, col='blue', add=T)
```

```{r}
taylorSeries <- function(f){
  function(x){
    print(x)
    print(f)
    res <- 0
    n <- 0
    print(res)
    while(n <= f){
      print('in loop')
      c <- ((-1 ^ n)/ factorial(n)) * x^n
      print(c)
      res <- res +  c
      print(res)
      print(x)
      print(n)
      n <- n + 1
    }
    print(res)
    res
  }
}
t1 <- taylorSeries(4)
curve(t1, -2,2, col='blue')
```
